alert.note: Alert for Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 9:15PM EDT until July 28 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Carroll and Owen. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Worthville, Eagle Station, Wheatley, Squiresville, English and Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 40.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
